title: Physical pendulums - period of doubled-length bar

content.question: A physical pendulum is made from a uniform bar with a pivot at its top end. A second physical pendulum is made from another uniform bar of twice the length, also with a pivot at its top end. How does the small-angle oscillation period of the second pendulum compare to that of the first? The rotational inertia about one end for a bar of mass <math alttext="uppercase M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>M</mi></math> and length <math alttext="L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>L</mi></math> is <math alttext="one third uppercase M L squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac><mi>M</mi><msup><mi>L</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math>.

choices.label: It is less, but more than half as much.
It is greater, but less than twice as much.

content.answer: It is greater, but less than twice as much.
